Description: Necklace: a string, composed of many small discs (some mis-shapen), larger oblate and mis-shapen spherical beads, short barrel and short cylindrical beads, two long tabular beads and two large moulded beads (one a truncated convex bicone, the other a large short truncated conical bead) all of green, bright-blue or purplish-black glazed composition, and a single shell disc bead.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3248 Found before the knees of a woman.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.345 & 1930,0711.342 & 1930,0711.343), necklaces (1930,0711.348 & 1930,0711.349 & 1930,0711.350 & 1930,0711.351), shell (1930,0711.347). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 120; pl.LXXVI, 21. 33; Tomb register, pl. LXXI; Bead register, pl.LXXIB.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (628)
